jhelp.gui.game

Class JHelpGame2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • jhelp.gui.JHelpFrame
                • jhelp.gui.JHelpFrameImage
                  • jhelp.gui.game.JHelpGame2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SnakeFrame

    public abstract class JHelpGame2D
extends JHelpFrameImage
    Frame for making a 2D game.
    It simplify life for keyboard/mouse management. Just implements EventManager and set it via setEventManager(EventManager).
    You can also do animation JHelpAnimation and associate it to a sprite JHelpSprite va playAnimmation(JHelpAnimation, JHelpSprite).
    You can have access to the image through the method JHelpFrameImage.getImage(), a short cut for create sprite exists : createSprite(int, int, int, int).
    A preferences file is automatically created and associated to the game, the name depends on the title, and to have an access to this preferences, use getPreferences().
    The key are some action keys, listed in ActionKey, you can set/get key mapping to action via setKeyCode(ActionKey, int) and getKeyCode(ActionKey).
    The base name getBaseName() is used to know the external directory name where stored preferences, it is a good idea to store other game external things here, think about UtilIO.obtainExternalFile(jhelpGame2D.getBaseName()) or obtainRecommendedExternalDirectory() to have the directory.
    Author:
    JHelp
    See Also:

        public jhelp.util.gui.JHelpSprite createSprite(int x,
                                      int y,
                                      int width,
                                      int height)
        Create a sprite for embed image, this sprite can be animated with playAnimmation(JHelpAnimation, JHelpSprite).
        Remember, sprite are by default hide, to show them, use sprite.setVisible(true);
        Parameters:
        x - Start sprite X position
        y - Start sprite Y position
        width - Sprite width
        height - Sprite height
        Returns:
        Created sprite

      • setKeyCode

        public ActionKey setKeyCode(ActionKey actionKey,
                   int keyCode)
        Change key code associated to a action key.
        If the key code is already mapped to a different action, then the mapped action is unmapped (that is to say that the action have no more key code associated), then the desired association is done. We return the action that have loose is association (or null if none) to let a chance to developer to alert the user that a key an action is unmapped and do appropriate action.
        Parameters:
        actionKey - Action key to change its key code
        keyCode - New associated key code
        Returns:
        Previous action key associated to the key code (This action have no more key code associated).Return null if the action have already this key code or no action is previously associated to this key code

      • unregisterMouseSensitiveAreaListener

        public void unregisterMouseSensitiveAreaListener(MouseSensitiveAreaListener mouseSensitiveAreaListener)
        Unregister a mouse area listener
        Parameters:
        mouseSensitiveAreaListener - Listener to remove
